Location.description: Location of the receiver - area, country, e.g. Auckland, New Zealand.

Min Elevation-NOAA.description: The minimum maximum pass elevation to record a pass, e.g. 15.

Min Elevation-METEOR.description: The minimum maximum pass elevation to record a pass, e.g. 15.

Min Elevation-SSTV.description: The minimum maximum pass elevation to record a pass, e.g. 15.

Min Elevation-AMSAT.description: The minimum maximum pass elevation to record a pass, e.g. 15.

Pass Highlight Elevation.description: Highlight rows which exceed this maximum pass elevation, e.g. 45.

Pass List Days.description: Number of additional days of pass data to calculate, e.g. 3.

Hide Detail.description: Hide detailed pass information, e.g. UTC date and times.

Link Base.description: Link base directory [note that changing this will require updating the static html pages too], e.g. /.

save .wav files.description: Save .wav files after pass - no will delete them.

email receive output.description: Email output of the receive code. It will be also in the log files if the logging level is debug.

plot thumbnail size.description: Size of the generated plot thumbnail, e.g. 58x68.

drive space location.description: Drive location to monitor for space used, e.g. /dev/root.

drive space error.description: Monitored drive space location percent remaining error threshold, e.g. 90.

drive space warning.description: Monitored drive space location percent remaining warning threshold, e.g. 70.

twilight allowance.description: Allowance in minutes to account for difference between sunrise and civil sunrise, e.g. 45.

webpage keywords.description: A list of the keywords to be included in the header part of each dynamically created webpage, e.g. wxcapture, weather, satellite

gain 20.description: SDR gain setting for up to 20 degree pass maximum elevation, e.g. 37.2

gain 30.description: SDR gain setting for above 20 and less than or equal to 30 degree pass maximum elevation, e.g. 37.2

gain 60.description: SDR gain setting for above 30 and less than or equal to 60 degree pass maximum elevation, e.g. 37.2

gain 90.description: SDR gain setting for above 60 and less than or equal to 90 degree pass maximum elevation, e.g. 37.2

auto gain.description: Use the SDR auto gain, e.g. no. If no, then the gain xx value is used.

sample rate.description: SDR bandwidth in Hz for recording NOAA audio, e.g. 37000

tweet min elevation.description: Minimum elevation to tweet an image, e.g. 20

discord webhooks.description: Send post to Discord webhooks (tweet must be yes for this to happen), e.g. yes

discord colour.description: Discord post colour bar which uses rrggbb for the colour as a hexidecimal value, e.g. ff0000

remote user.description: Name of the user on the system where the files are copied to via rsync, e.g. USER.

remote directory.description: Name of the directory on the system where the files are copied to via rsync, e.g. /home/USER/wxcapture/output.

remote host.description: IP address for the system where the files are copied to via rsync, e.g. 10.0.0.1.

tweet to.description: Twitter handle of the account to tweet from, prefixed by an @, e.g. @RaspberryPiNZ.

consumer key.description: Consumer key for the Twitter API credentials as configured in Twitter

consumer secret.description: Consumer secret for the Twitter API credentials as configured in Twitter

access token.description: Access token for the Twitter API credentials as configured in Twitter

access token secret.description: Access token secret for the Twitter API credentials as configured in Twitter

name.description: Descriptive name for the satellite, e.g. METEOR-M 2.

NORAD catalog number.description: NORAD catalog number for the satellite, e.g. 40069

frequency.description: Frequency that the satellite broadcasts on and that the SDR will be tuned to, e.g. 137.1000

meteor symbol rate.description: Symbol rate for Meteor satellites, e.g. 72000, otherwise set to 0

meteor mode.description: Decoder mode for Meteor satellites, e.g. qpsk, otherwise set to n/a

active.description: If the satellite is active then it will be included in the table of predicted passes, e.g. yes.

capture.description: Controls if the pass will be captured, e.g. yes. Note that this will only happen if the value of active is yes.

night.description: Controls if the pass will be captured at night for Meteor sattellites, otherwise set to yes for other satellites.

priority.description: Relative priority to capture this satellite compared to other satellites, e.g. 10, with higher priority satellites taking priority over lower priority satellites to be captured if there are overlapping passes by multiple satellites.

sdr.description: Which SDR (and antenna) to use to record the capture, e.g. QFH. There must be corresponding data in the sdr.json file for this value.

name.description: Descriptive name for the SDF, e.g. QFH.

antenna.description: Descriptive name for the antenna that is connected to the SDR, e.g. Quadrifilar Helicoidal antenna

chipset.description: Chipset name used by the SDR, e.g. RTL2838UHIDIR

sdr type.description: Descriptive name for the SDR, e.g. RTL-SDR v3

centre frequency.description: Centre frequency to which the antenna that is connected to the SDR is tuned to, e.g. 137.6 MHz

frequency range.description: Frequency range to which the antenna that is connected to the SDR is sensitive to, e.g. 135-140 MHz from bandpass filter

modules.description: Modules which are between the antenna and the SDR, e.g. RTL-SDR FM Block, Nooelec NOAA Sawbird (LNA + Bandpass Filter)

sdr active.description: If the SDR is active or not, e.g. yes

bias t.description: If the bias T needs to be enabled for the SDR, e.g. on. Only do this if there is something using bias T as otherwise you may damage your SDR. This currently assumes an RTL-SDR v3 is being used.
